parsed.internal_thinking: Alice started strong with Node 20, taking the 6-Brick and 8-Sheep. To compete, I need a high-yield settlement that provides expansion resources. Node 12 is an excellent choice, offering 11 total pips across Brick (6), Sheep (5), and Wood (3). This gives me a solid foundation for building roads and settlements. While Node 43 has higher pips (13), it's entirely Wheat, which is less flexible for early-game expansion. By choosing Node 12, I secure the other side of the 6-Brick hex. I'll point my road towards Node 13, which opens a path to Node 14 (Wheat 8, Wood 4) and potentially the 2:1 Brick port at Node 6, which would be extremely powerful given the 6-Brick income. Node 12 is one of the few high-yield Brick spots on the board, making it a high priority for my first placement. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Priority for 2nd settlement: Look for Ore and Wheat to balance the Wood/Brick from Node 12. Node 41 or 42 would be ideal if they remain open. Keep an eye on Charlie's placements to see if he tries to cut off the path to the Brick port.
parsed.say_outloud: Nice choice on that 6-Brick, Alice! I think I'll take a share of that action too. Node 12 looks like a great spot to start building my empire. Good luck, Charlie!
